SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler

Interface ServerEhloReplyHandler

All Superinterfaces:
ServerReplyHandler
public interface ServerEhloReplyHandler extends ServerReplyHandler
Handler for EHLO command response.

This handler receives the server's response to an EHLO command, including the advertised SMTP extensions. On success, the handler receives detailed capability information and a ClientSession interface for continuing the session.

If EHLO is not supported (502), the handler should fall back to HELO using the provided ClientHelloState interface.

Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:

  • ClientHelloState

    handleServiceClosing

  • Method Details

    • handleEhlo

      void handleEhlo(boolean starttls, long maxSize, List<String> authMethods, boolean pipelining, ClientSession session)
      Called when the server accepts EHLO (250).

      The handler receives the server's advertised capabilities and can proceed with the session. Based on the capabilities, the handler may choose to:

      • Upgrade to TLS via session.starttls() if starttls is true
      • Authenticate via session.auth() if authMethods is not empty
      • Begin sending mail via session.mailFrom()
      Parameters:
      starttls - true if STARTTLS extension is available
      maxSize - maximum message size in bytes (0 if SIZE not advertised)
      authMethods - list of available SASL mechanisms (empty if AUTH not advertised)
      pipelining - true if PIPELINING extension is available
      session - operations available in the established session

    • handleEhloNotSupported

      void handleEhloNotSupported(ClientHelloState hello)
      Called when EHLO is not supported (502).

      The handler should fall back to using HELO with the provided ClientHelloState interface.

      Parameters:
      hello - operations to retry with HELO

    • handlePermanentFailure

      void handlePermanentFailure(String message)
      Called when the server permanently rejects the client (5xx other than 502).

      This indicates the server will not accept connections from this client. The connection will be closed.

      Parameters:
      message - the server's rejection message
